law.text:
The following definitions apply in this chapter unless the context otherwise requires:
"Building," in addition to its ordinary meaning, means any structure, vehicle, watercraft or aircraft:
Where any person lives; or
Where people assemble for purposes of business, government, education, religion, entertainment or public transportation. Each unit of a building consisting of two (2) or more units separately secured or occupied is a separate building.
"Dwelling" means a building which is usually occupied by a person lodging therein.
"Premises" includes the term "building" as defined herein and any real property.
law.history: Amended 1980 Ky. Acts ch. 376, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1980. -- Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 96, effective January 1, 1975.
